resources.string: In the stroop test, a text spelling a name of a random color will be shown to you for a period of 3 seconds. The color of the text will differ from the color that is spelled out by the text. After the text disappears from the screen, you have to press the "Listen" button and spell out the color of the text that was shown to you, NOT the name of the color spelled out by the text. After spelling the color, another text will be presented. This process will be repeated 20 times. Your goal is to correctly pronounce the name of the color of the text as many times as possible.

In the trail making test, your goal is to connect the dots displayed on the canvas in the correct order, in 1 continuous stroke. If you make a mistake, or remove your finger from the screen before connecting all the dots, the line drawn will be cleared and you will have to start again. The final score of the test consists of the time it took you to complete the test and the number of mistakes made.

In the digit substitution test, you will be presented with a series of symbols corresponding to digits. The legend depicting which symbol corresponds to which digit is visible at the top of the screen. During the duration of the test, that spans 2 minutes, you will be presented with a series of digits. You have to match the digit presented in the middle of the screen with the one of the symbols, to do that, press one of the buttons corresponding to the symbols, on the bottom of the screen. Final score of the tests consists of the number of correctly matched symbol-digit pairs and the number of mistakes.
